translation.en: [Owen] ♪ I knew you were trouble When you walked in ♪
translation.ko: 네가 들어왔을 때 문제가 있다는 걸 알았어

translation.en: ♪ Now I'm lying on the cold, hard ground ♪
translation.ko: 이제 난 차갑고 단단한 바닥에 누워 있지

translation.en: Who the fuck are these guys?
Overwatch One. Come in, Overwatch One. Overwatch, we got a problem.
translation.ko: 감시 1조, 응답하라, 감시 1조 감시조, 문제가 생겼다

translation.en: Do you copy?
[woman] Stay off this channel.
No, we have a serious problem. Did you not hear me?
translation.ko: 심각한 문제가 생겼다고요 내 말 못 들었어요?

translation.en: That's why you ever bring a lawyer on an op. Stay off this channel.
translation.ko: 변호사는 작전에 데려오지 마 이 채널 쓰지 말라고

translation.en: Fuck!
♪ I was like, good gracious Ass is bodacious, uh ♪ ♪ Flirtatious, tryin' to show faces, ah ♪
Mr. Nyland will see you now.
Great. Thank you.
-Sir. -Are you Henderson?
Uh, Hendricks, sir. Owen Hendricks.
How long you been here, Mr. Hendricks?
Only ten minutes, but you're very busy. You're running the whole operation--
translation.ko: 10분밖에 안 됐습니다 바쁘신 것 알아요, 모든 작전을…

translation.en: You mean how long I've been working here. About two days. Just finished CIA 101.
translation.ko: 법무실 말이군요, 이틀 됐어요 CIA 훈련을 막 끝냈죠

translation.en: I'm sending you to the Senate.
Score.
Word is, head of the Senate Intelligence Committee is planning
to read a classified document at a public hearing.
Okay, and you want me to tell him he can't.
Tell him that he's an engorged ball sack
who should walk into an airplane propeller.
Yes, sir. You mean tell him that figuratively.
No, I don't. Listen to me carefully, Mr. Hendricks.
translation.ko: 아니, 그렇지 않아 잘 들어, 헨드릭스

translation.en: If you fail to stop Senator Smoot from reading that document...
you won't be working here tomorrow. Am I clear?
translation.ko: 내일부턴 출근 안 해도 돼 알아듣겠어?

translation.en: You're a dead man walking.
Nyland thinks he can keep me in the dark on the agency's covert clusterfucks,
translation.ko: 나일랜드가 CIA의 실수를 감출 수 있다고 믿나 본데

translation.en: but he's wrong!
If I wanna read a document, I'll read a document!
translation.ko: 문서를 읽고 안 읽고는 내가 결정해!

translation.en: I have a constitutional mandate to oversee the CIA,
translation.ko: 난 CIA를 감독할 헌법상의 권한이 있다고

translation.en: and I am gonna exercise the hell out of it, starting by subpoenaing you.
translation.ko: 자네 소환을 필두로 그 권한을 실컷 행사해 주지

translation.en: Now, I'm going back into my hearing...
and I'm quoting this document.
Sir, that is completely your prerogative as you are head of... the committee,
translation.ko: 인용 여부야 전적으로 뭐시기 위원장님의 특권이지만

translation.en: but may I just remind you that revealing classified information
is in violation of 18 U.S. code section 798
and will result in not only criminal sanctions,
but potential reprimand and censure in the Senate.
Also, that type of shit looks really bad in a campaign video against you.
translation.ko: 안티 스무트 캠페인 영상에 실리면 볼 만하겠어요

translation.en: If there's nothing else I can help with, I gotta get back to Langley.
translation.ko: 더 이상 도울 일이 없으면 랭글리로 돌아가겠습니다

translation.en: It was a pleasure meeting you.
-How did it go? -Pretty good.
-[Smoot yelling] Dave! -Thanks for your help.
[Smoot] In my office! Now!
Hey. Did you check out that new CIA swag?
translation.ko: 이봐, 새로 나온 CIA 기념품 봤어?

translation.en: Yeah. I'm gonna get me one of those ski masks.
translation.ko: 당연하지, 그 스키 마스크 살 거야

translation.en: Yeah. Those are nice, right?
-I don't even ski. -Well...
-I just wanna look like a bank robber. -Oh, oh, oh.
Here we go.
Oh, shit-- I'm sorry.
[Lester] Okay. What?
-Yeah. Hi. This is my office. -We heard Nyland sent you to Capitol Hill.
translation.ko: - 제 방이 맞네요 - 국회 의사당 다녀왔다며?

translation.en: Yeah, I didn't get to the Senate for six months. You get there on day two?
-Trust me, it wasn't a reward. -What was the assignment?
Just advising on a classification.
Don't lie to us, Hendricks. I was a professional sneak.
We know you met with the head of Senate Intelligence.
translation.ko: 정보 위원장 만난 것 다 안다고

translation.en: Yeah. And I got my ass handed to me.
I was straight-up cannon fodder in the Nyland-Smoot feud.
Only reason the general counsel sent me was--
[Lester] Because new guys get the shit work.
What the hell is this?
[Lester] This is the crazies.
-[Violet] The nutjobs. -People trying to graymail the CIA.
translation.ko: - 미친놈들이 보낸… - CIA 기밀 공개 협박 편지

translation.en: [Violet] Every letter is from someone
threatening to expose classified information if we don't help them.
-That's extortion. -[Lester] Yet we get hundreds a year.
translation.ko: - 그건 갈취예요 - 매년 수백 통이 오지

translation.en: Your job? Vet each one of those. See if the author can back up the threat.
translation.ko: 일일이 읽어 보고 믿을 만한 걸 가려내라고

translation.en: -How often does that happen? -[Lester] Hmm.
It happens.
Yeah. Oh, and if the secrets they're threatening to reveal are bad,
it's a nightmare to navigate.
-That is a lot of coffee. -Fuck.
I can't afford to fall asleep.
-Why? You got a brief? -A brief? No. I work directly with SOG.
translation.ko: - 변론 취지서 쓰세요? - 취지서? 난 SOG랑 직접 일해

translation.en: Sorry, who are they? I'm struggling to keep all the acronyms straight.
translation.ko: 그게 누구죠? 약어가 아직 익숙지 않아요

translation.en: Special Operations Group.
Imagine if meth became sentient and was given weaponry.
translation.ko: 지각이 생긴 필로폰이 무기를 쥐었다고 상상하면 돼

translation.en: I've been in this building for three straight days,
but if I leave, those crazy fucks are gonna green-light a covert op
translation.ko: 내가 가면 그 나쁜 놈들이 나 홀로 막고 있던

translation.en: that I am single-handedly keeping them from executing.
They don't listen to their lawyer?
No, this place is an organization of con men,
which makes us lawyers for cheats and liars
who are actively trying to sabotage us.
If you have any brains, get out before the ink dries on your paperwork, kid.
Thanks.
[woman] I've been unjustly imprisoned in Connecticut.
I don't know how that ham ended up in my purse.
translation.ko: 그 햄이 왜 내 지갑에 있었는지 모르겠어요

translation.en: [man 1] I know about the aliens. I worked for the agency in Cuba in 1963.
translation.ko: 외계인에 관해 알아요 1963년에 쿠바 기관에서 일했죠

translation.en: [man 2] It was a false flag operation.
[man 3] If you don't help me, I'll expose all I know about the JFK assassination.
translation.ko: 돕지 않으면 케네디 암살에 관해 내가 아는 모든 걸 폭로하겠어요

translation.en: [man 4] My boyfriend is cheating on me.
If you don't get him to stop, I'll expose all the secret CIA prisons in Jersey.
translation.ko: 손 안 쓰면 저지에 있는 CIA 비밀 감옥을 폭로하겠어요

translation.en: [woman] My name is Max Meladze.
I'm in prison in Phoenix.
Get me out or I will spill agency secrets on Selby Shaw, PW Butcher, and more.
translation.ko: 안 풀어주면 셀비 쇼, PW 부처 등 CIA 비밀을 폭로하겠다

translation.en: You owe me.
-Yo. Whoa, whoa, whoa! -Jesus Christ! Okay.
It's just Owen. You good?
It's me, from the coffee... room.
What do you want?
Working on the crazies, hoping you could help me.
No. Absolutely not.
It'll take a second.
Rule number one: Never help anyone around here.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 규칙 여기선 아무도 도와주지 마라

translation.en: And definitely do not trust anyone.
This place is designed to pit us against each other.
Okay.
Got it. Except I really do need your help.
So, what can I do to get you to answer a few questions?
translation.ko: 어떡하면 몇 가지 질문에 대답해 줄래요?

translation.en: Do you have any speed?
No.
-Well, this has been fun. Toodle-oo. -My roommate takes Adderall.
translation.ko: - 즐거웠어, 잘 가 - 룸메한테 애더럴이 있어요

translation.en: Good enough. Five pills for every question. Go.
Okay, so I got this letter and I came across a very weird name, PW Butcher.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 이 편지에 PW 부처라는 이상한 이름이 나오는데

translation.en: Any idea what that means?
Yeah, that's a cryptonym.
An agency code name for a clandestine operation.
The first two letters, PW, are a digraph,
translation.ko: 첫 두 글자 PW는 이중 문자로

translation.en: literally the country code where the operation is taking place,
and the two-syllable word that follows, Butcher, is the actual code name.
Where did you find that?
In the graymail letter. Some woman in prison for murder.
translation.ko: 살인죄로 수감된 여자가 기밀 공개 협박 편지를 보냈어요

translation.en: Yeah, there's no way an asset should know an agency cryptonym
translation.ko: 자산이라면 CIA 암호명을 알 리가 없어

translation.en: or even know they exist.
Does that mean this is the real deal?
-Pfft. Not my department. Mm-mm. -Come on.
I'll give you ten extra pills.
Do I follow up on this or not?
I wouldn't.
Why does it feel like that's a yes?
Okay, if you were not gonna follow up on this, where would you not go?
translation.ko: 좋아요, 조사 안 한다고 치면 어딜 안 찾아가겠어요?

translation.en: I gotta talk to someone about an old op.
translation.ko: 예전 작전에 관해 물어볼 게 있어요

translation.en: Excuse me, ladies, could you--? What's up, dude? Could you, uh--?
My name's Owen Hendricks from the general counsel's office.
Not interested.
I can respect that, but I got questions that need answering.
Make it fast.
Sure.
What can you tell me about the cryptonym PW Butcher?
translation.ko: PW 부처라는 암호명에 관해 아는 것 있어요?

translation.en: PW is the country code for Belarus, and then Butcher...
translation.ko: PW는 벨라루스의 국가 코드고 부처는 2009년 벨라루스에서 시행된 작전 코드명이에요

translation.en: is a code name for an operation in Belarus in 2009.
Okay. Great. And what about the name Selby Shaw?
-What about it? -Is it connected to PW Butcher?
translation.ko: - 그게 뭐요? - PW 부처와 관련 있어요?

translation.en: I don't have access to the specifics,
but Selby Shaw is a pseudonym for a DO officer
who operated in Belarus at that time.
Hmm. Okay. They're both tracking as--
Would you mind putting in the name Max Meladze? Maxine Meladze.
M-E-L-A-D-Z-E. See what comes up.
Please.
Nothing.
-You sure? -Yeah.
What's this about, anyways?
Agency got a graymail letter from Meladze.
translation.ko: 멜라제가 CIA에 기밀 공개 협박 편지를 보냈어요

translation.en: Jesus Christ.
-What? -There's no way anyone outside the agency
should know a classified agency cryptonym and an officer pseudonym.
translation.ko: CIA 암호명이나 요원 가명을 알 방법은 없어요

translation.en: -Could Meladze could be one of ours? -Not without her showing up in the system.
translation.ko: 그럼 멜라제가 CIA다? 그렇다면 시스템에 떠야죠

translation.en: But?
But it's possible she was a hip-pocket asset,
so there wouldn't be a file on her and no way to ID her case officer.
translation.ko: 그럼 파일도 없고 사건 담당자는 베일에 싸이죠

translation.en: Why would her handler soft file her in the first place?
She could've been a new source he hadn't fully vetted.
With that level of institutional knowledge?
No.
That's troubling.
Okay.
Listen to me. I need you to give me Selby Shaw's real name.
-And you think this is real? -[Owen] Yes.
Sir, she knows classified information.
-And you ran all this down in a few hours. -Yes, sir.
translation.ko: - 이걸 몇 시간 만에 알아냈다? - 네

translation.en: And I have a lead on where to go next. Our operative's real name.
translation.ko: 다음 단계에 대한 단서도 있어요 우리 요원의 실명입니다

translation.en: Selby Shaw is a pseudonym for Dawn Gilbane.
translation.ko: 셀비 쇼는 돈 길베인의 가명이죠 "셀비 쇼 돈 길베인"

translation.en: What the hell is wrong with you?
Never write an officer's true name and their pseudonym on the same paper.
translation.ko: 요원의 실명과 가명을 같은 종이에 써선 절대로 안 돼

translation.en: -Uh, sorry, sir, I didn't know. -Get Kitchens and Ebner in here.
This can't be good.
-Where is she now? -[Owen] Meladze? At a prison in Phoenix.
-No, the operative. -[Owen] Gilbane.
She's at an agency black site in Yemen.
Yes, sir? [Nyland] Who had the crazies before Hendricks?
-I did. -[Nyland] Did you even open the folder?
Of course, sir. I did my due diligence with everything in there--
Keep going with the investigation.
These two will pick up the slack on your workload.
Yes, sir.
-[Nyland clears throat] -Yes, sir?
Oh, sh--
-Thanks for screwing me over. -I'm sorry, man. I had no idea.
[Lester] Yeah, bullshit. You set me up.
You set yourself up by doing jack shit with those folders when you had them.
translation.ko: 스스로 판 거겠죠 일을 제대로 안 했잖아요

translation.en: That's not true. Violet had the folders before me.
-How many cases of graymail did you find? -A few. So, what's the story?
translation.ko: - 쓸 만한 협박이 있었어? - 몇 개는, 자세히 말해 봐

translation.en: A possible hip-pocket asset that knows too much.
translation.ko: 너무 많은 걸 아는 뒷주머니 자산이 있어요

translation.en: How do I get to Yemen?
Nyland didn't say, "Go to Yemen."
He said: "Keep going with the investigation."
Yes, but the answers I need are in Yemen. So how do I get there?
Travel coach. Rent an economy car.
Seriously?
Yeah. And keep the receipts for everything.
translation.ko: 응, 영수증 챙기는 것 잊지 말고

translation.en: They don't call this place "the Company" for nothing.
[laughing] I don't think I've ever seen you dance like that before.
translation.ko: 너 그렇게 춤추는 거 처음 봐

translation.en: This is amazing. [laughing]
-All right. What's up? -[Hannah] Okay.
If I get this in, you have to buy groceries for the week.
translation.ko: 내가 성공하면 네가 일주일 치 식료품 사기

translation.en: -Oh, wow, that was so close. -[Terrence] Ooh.
Okay, you have gotta clean the bathroom. No. You gotta clean Owen and I's shower.
translation.ko: 좋아, 욕실 청소하기 다시, 우리 샤워실 청소하기

translation.en: [Hannah] That sounds disgusting.
Whoo! Thank you.
-Hey. -[Owen] Hi.
Did you bring beer? I texted you.
Uh, no. You didn't.
-Huh. -Hey.
-What's up, Bubba? -[Hannah] I texted my mom.
No, you slow down, Mother.
-Ooh. Sucks. Is there any food? -Uh, there might be some pizza left.
translation.ko: - 이런, 먹을 것 있어? - 피자가 좀 남았을 거야

translation.en: [Owen] What are you wearing?
It's Tad's. We're role playing later.
translation.ko: 태드 거야 이따 역할극을 할 거거든

translation.en: I am making a special delivery.
I'm so sorry that I asked.
-I'll take that. -[Terrence] Where you going?
-Ah. You got next. -I gotta pack.
To go where?
It's classified.
Look how smug he is about that.
So smug. Why so smug?
Are you ready, Chicago?
So, seriously, where are you going?
Seriously, I can't tell you.
Okay. Well, how's your new job?
Have you made any new friends or overthrown any foreign governments?
No to the friends. Maybe to the governments.
Fingers crossed.
-[clears throat] Your mom called me. -Oh? Apparently, you forgot to tell her that we aren't dating anymore.
translation.ko: 어머님 전화 왔었어 우리 헤어진 거 말 안 했더라

translation.en: Well, I haven't talked to her in six months,
so she also doesn't know I work at the CIA.
You can't avoid dealing with her forever.
[Owen] Sure I can.
-Hey, how's the firm? -Ugh.
All I do is freeze my ass off in a conference room,
reading technical specs on homicidal dialysis machines.
translation.ko: 살인 투석기에 관한 기술 사양을 읽었어

translation.en: The joy of being a first year at a law firm.
You should've joined the agency with me.
Oh, my God. Could you imagine? My parents would kill me.
There's this cool thing.
It's called "not giving a fuck what your parents think." Super liberating.
translation.ko: '부모님 생각은 개나 줘 버려' 얼마나 자유로운데

translation.en: -Did you find out where he's going? -My powers of seduction were ineffective.
Do you mind if I take this?
-No. -[Owen] Thank you.
Well, he's definitely flying because he's packing a carry-on,
translation.ko: 기내 가방을 싸는 걸로 봐서 타는 건 비행기인데

translation.en: but he is not flying for long because he's only packing a carry-on.
translation.ko: 기내 가방만 싸는 걸로 봐서 목적지가 멀진 않아

translation.en: Your powers of deduction are wasted at the Department of Treasury.
translation.ko: 넌 네 추리력을 재무부에서 낭비하고 있어

translation.en: Okay, just for that, Tad and I, we're gonna role play in your room tonight
translation.ko: 태드랑 네 방에서 역할극 할 거야

translation.en: once you're off circumnavigating the globe in your government jet.
translation.ko: 네가 정부 제트기 타고 세계 일주 떠나고 나면

translation.en: -I don't get a jet. -Since when do spies fly commercial?
translation.ko: - 제트기 안 타 - 스파이가 민간 여객기도 타?

translation.en: I'm not a spy.
I am a lawyer.
Hey! [laughs]
What's going on, man? How's it going?
I'm Owen Hendricks over at the general counsel's office.
Oh, shit. Oh, fuck. Okay, listen, man. No, no, no. Wait. Whoa!
God.
Hey, hi. I think there's been a mistake. Fuck.
Wow. You guys really loosened these teeth.
I'm an American, dumbass. So, there's been--
Thank God. Hi. I'm Owen Hendricks from the general counsel's office.
And you just thought you'd pop by a black site unannounced.
translation.ko: 예고도 없이 블랙 사이트를 방문해도 된다고 생각했어?

translation.en: Sorry. Was I supposed to call?
There was no cable traffic about your trip.
No clearance from the ambassador or diplomatic cover.
-Well, I'm new. -You're an idiot.
-Or just pretending to be one. -It's actually neither of those.
translation.ko: - 그런 척하거나, 둘 중 하나야 - 둘 다 아녜요

translation.en: -Hmm. -I flew all the way here to talk to you about an old op
translation.ko: 예전 작전에 관해 물어볼 게 있어서

translation.en: -from many years ago. What--? -Bullshit. Bullshit.
-What color is this? -[chuckles]
Blue?
You really are new. Otherwise, the agency would have issued you a black passport
translation.ko: 진짜 신입이구나, 그러니 CIA가 발급하는 까만 여권이 없지

translation.en: which grants you diplomatic immunity.
translation.ko: 그게 있어야 외교 면책 특권이 생겨

translation.en: No one told me that.
-Strip him. -[Owen] What?
What? Wait a second. What are you doing? No, no. Whoa, guys.
translation.ko: 잠깐만요, 뭘 하는 거죠? 안 돼요, 이봐요

translation.en: Fuck. No. Hey, this is a new suit. What is going on?
translation.ko: 젠장, 안 돼, 새 양복이야! 뭐 하는 짓이야?

translation.en: [Dawn] That's what I wanna know. No way you came out here to talk about an old op.
translation.ko: 내가 묻고 싶어, 예전 작전에 관해 얘기하려고 이곳에 올 리가 없잖아

translation.en: I think you're here to investigate us, which makes you a hostile. But you fucked up.
translation.ko: 우릴 조사하러 온 거야 그러니 적이지, 근데 넌 망했어

translation.en: Without a cover identity and a diplomatic passport,
the Yemeni secret police will arrest you for spying and shoot you in the head.
translation.ko: 예멘 비밀 경찰이 스파이로 체포해 머리통에 총을 갈기거든

translation.en: With a black passport, you just get deported.
But someone should have told you that before you got on the plane.
translation.ko: 비행기에 오르기 전에 누가 말해줘야 했다고

translation.en: -Made some enemies at work already? -Looks like it.
translation.ko: - 직장에서 벌써 적을 만들었어? - 그런 것 같네요

translation.en: -You sure don't have any friends here. -All right. Let's-- Wait.
So... here's what's gonna happen.
You're gonna tell me what you're really doing in my black site
or the PSO is gonna get an anonymous tip you're up to no good.
translation.ko: 아니면 네가 나쁜 짓 꾸민다고 예멘 정치 보안국에 알릴 거야

translation.en: You're gonna end up with a cattle prod in one end, a hollow point in the other.
translation.ko: 그럼 한쪽 끝엔 소몰이 막대 다른 쪽 끝엔 총알이 박힐걸

translation.en: No, no, no.
[screams] Fuck!
God! I'm telling you the truth! I came across a graymail
translation.ko: 맙소사! 내 말은 사실이에요! 내가 찾은 기밀 공개 협박 편지가

translation.en: that was connected to a fucking operation that you ran. Wait, wait, listen to me.
translation.ko: 당신이 담당했던 작전과 관련이 있어서 왔다고요, 잠깐만요

translation.en: It's my first week on the job. I got recruited in law school.
I said no to a bunch of high-paying jobs
translation.ko: 내가 고임금 직장을 다 거절한 건

translation.en: because I got this pathological need for stimulation.
Probably 'cause my dad got blown up in Afghanistan.
My mom never got over it.
I have just been running away
from having to spend any longer than five minutes with my thoughts alone ever since.
translation.ko: 혼자 생각에 잠겨야 하는 일은 피했죠

translation.en: So, yeah, when that recruit came
and he promised me I could do cool stuff, I thought, "Fuck it."
translation.ko: 멋진 일을 하게 해 준댔을 때 '한번 해 보자' 했어요

translation.en: And, you know, fuck it. Maybe I'll even make my dad proud.
You know, I have been faking it until I made it for my entire life,
translation.ko: 난 확실히 알기 전까지 가장하는 버릇이 있는데

translation.en: but I'm sorry because I can fucking understand
how I have clearly miscalculated applying that approach to the agency.
What's the op?
PW Butcher. The asset's name is Maxine Meladze.
translation.ko: PW 부처요 자산 이름은 맥신 멜라제

translation.en: She wrote us a graymail letter.
Cut him loose.
Yeah, I fucking pissed myself.
Congratulations. You are good at your jobs.
[Dawn] I never met Meladze.
But you remember her.
Vaguely.
I used HUMINT from her to carry out an op.
If I remember right, she was a pretty valuable asset.
translation.ko: 내 기억이 맞는다면 꽤 유용한 자산이었어

translation.en: Upper-level player of the Belarus chapter of the Russian mafia.
She had serious connections inside Russian intelligence.
-Who was her handler? -Sorry, I don't remember.
It was a long time ago, and I've run a hundred ops since then.
translation.ko: 오래전 일이고 이후로 많은 작전을 수행했거든

translation.en: But she was a big deal.
And the fact that somebody would hip-pocket a girl like that
should scare the crap out of you.
Listen, sorry about the enhanced interrogation.
-Yeah. -Some guys might hold a grudge.
I chalk it up to a communication breakdown and a lesson on the importance
translation.ko: 의사소통 오류 때문이니 다음부터 비밀 공작국과 교류할 땐

translation.en: of following protocol when interacting with clandestine services.
So I don't have to tell anyone at Langley about the whole torture thing?
translation.ko: 고문당한 얘긴 랭글리에 하지 말란 건가요?

translation.en: Exactly. Although some people might enjoy hearing about it.
Yeah. Pretty sure I can smooth things out with them, though.
Working at the CIA is like a never ending game of musical chairs.
translation.ko: CIA는 끝나지 않는 의자 차지하기 놀이와 같아

translation.en: Everyone is maneuvering to figure out who will have a seat when the music stops.
translation.ko: 음악이 멈추면 먼저 차지하려고 혈안이 돼 있지

translation.en: Easiest way to make sure you have a seat is to hamstring the guy next to you.
translation.ko: 가장 쉬운 방법은 옆 사람을 불구로 만드는 거야

translation.en: If you don't start playing, figuring out how shit works,
translation.ko: 반칙을 알아내고 너 역시 남을 속이지 않으면

translation.en: you're gonna be in trouble.
More trouble than getting my fingernail pulled out?
translation.ko: 손톱이 뽑히는 것보다 더 큰 곤경이 있어요?

translation.en: Nails grow back. Drive safe.
Keep an eye peeled for the PSO.
How did it go?
[Owen] Oh, I can't talk about it.
-What? -[Owen] I can't talk about it.
-Come on, man. Just let me sleep. -What are you wearing?
translation.ko: - 나가, 좀 자자 - 뭘 입은 거야?

translation.en: My suit got ruined.
I'm surprised they let you on the plane wearing that.
translation.ko: 이런 차림으로 비행기를 탄 게 용하네

translation.en: Suggests a country with lesser security standards.
-Third world, perhaps? -I said I can't talk about it.
translation.ko: - 제삼 세계겠지? - 말 못 한다고 했어

translation.en: -What's going on? -[Owen] Oh, my God.
-Owen was in the shit somewhere. -Owen loves being in the shit.
translation.ko: - 오언이 고생 진탕 했나 봐 - 고생 좋아하잖아

translation.en: -He didn't love this. -Can you guys please just let me sleep?
translation.ko: - 이번엔 아니었나 봐 - 잠 좀 자게 해줄래?

translation.en: What happened?
I can't talk about it.
But I'm fine.
You don't seem fine.
Come on.
What--? What are you doing?
Mm. Being human.
Come on. Get in here.
-I don't wanna wrinkle my outfit. -[Terrence] Said by no one young ever.
translation.ko: - 옷 구겨져 - 젊은 애가 못 하는 말이 없어

translation.en: I'm running late.
Call me if you wanna talk. Okay?
[Owen] Thank you.
Are you okay?
I am now.
Now, get out of my room.
Okay. Get some sleep.
-[cell phone ringing] -No.
-Hello. -[woman] Hold for the general counsel.
[Nyland] Where the fuck are you?
-[Owen] Hi. -How was Yemen?
It was great. No thanks to you two.
Look, I don't mind getting hazed 'cause I'm the new guy,
but if either one of you try to torpedo me like that again, we're gonna have a problem.
translation.ko: 또 그런 식으로 방해한다면 그땐 가만 안 있어요

translation.en: Now, I gotta get upstairs. General counsel needs me. Again.
translation.ko: 그만 가봐야 해요 실장님이 또 찾으셔서요

translation.en: Cheers.
[Owen] Without a 201 file, no way to know who Meladze's handler was.
But given that Agent Gilbane confirmed that Max was an asset,
translation.ko: 맥스가 자산이었다는 걸 길베인이 확인해준 이상

translation.en: we have to take the graymail threat seriously.
translation.ko: 이번 협박을 심각하게 받아들여야 할 겁니다

translation.en: -I didn't tell you to go to Yemen. -[Owen] Yes, sir.
translation.ko: - 예멘에 가라고 한 적 없어 - 그렇습니다

translation.en: I decided to make the judgment call that it was the necessary next step.
Plus, I figured you're the type of leader who appreciates initiative,
translation.ko: 실장님은 진취성을 높이 사는 분이기도 하고요

translation.en: but if you want me to get approval--
No. Initiative is good.
Nice job.
Thank you.
What happened to your hand?
Closed it in a car door.
Go to Phoenix. Talk to Meladze.
Yes, sir.
Now?
Sir, it's just, my day started three days ago.
Great. Yeah. Phoenix it is.
What can you tell me about Max Meladze?
She's been held without bail due to the brutal nature of her crime.
translation.ko: 수법이 워낙 잔인해 보석 없는 형을 선고받았어요

translation.en: -Who'd she kill? -A trucking guy named Salvatore Kwitny.
translation.ko: - 누굴 죽였죠? - 트럭 기사 살바토레 퀴트니요

translation.en: Phoenix PD thinks Miss Meladze was using his trucks to run product.
translation.ko: 그자 트럭으로 마약을 판매한 것으로 추정되고 있죠

translation.en: So, what is the CIA's interest in her?
Not at liberty to say, but I'll need a digital copy of her file
translation.ko: 기밀입니다, 멜라제의 파일을 디지털 복사해 주시고

translation.en: and a private room to meet with her. No listeners, no cameras.
translation.ko: 듣는 사람도, 카메라도 없는 방을 마련해 주세요

translation.en: Shall we?
Who are you?
I'm Owen Hendricks from the general counsel's office at the CIA.
We got your letter.
-Took you long enough. -Yeah, it's a busy place.
You know that making threats against the agency's a crime, right?
translation.ko: CIA에 그런 협박을 하는 건 범죄인 거 아시죠?

translation.en: I know many things.
More than you, that's for sure.
So how long has it been, huh? A few weeks?
translation.ko: 입사한 지 얼마 됐어? 몇 주?

translation.en: -You know how to use the copy machine? -We're not here to talk about me.
translation.ko: - 복사기 쓰는 법은 알아? - 내 얘길 하러 온 게 아녜요

translation.en: -What happened to your hand? -I closed it in a car door.
translation.ko: - 손은 왜 그래? - 자동차 문에 끼었어요

translation.en: Liar. I've pulled out enough fingernails to know what it looks like afterwards.
translation.ko: 거짓말, 손톱을 많이 뽑아 봐서 딱 보면 알아

translation.en: You seem really proud of that.
Shouldn't I be? Some of those nails were for the CIA.
translation.ko: 그럼 안 돼? CIA 때문에 뽑은 손톱도 있었어

translation.en: Oh, is that one of the things that you're threatening to expose?
No.
-So how do you like the agency so far? -It's great. Who was your handler?
translation.ko: - CIA에서 일하니 어때? - 끝내줘요, 핸들러가 누구였죠?

translation.en: Dumb question, because now I know you have no hard file on me.
translation.ko: 내 하드 파일이 없다는 걸 대놓고 알려주는군

translation.en: Which means you have no idea what I know or who I can burn.
translation.ko: 내가 뭘, 누굴 폭로할 수 있는지 모른다는 걸 말이야

translation.en: Maybe. But I'm gonna find out soon enough.
Only if I tell you, which I won't...
translation.ko: 내가 말 안 할 건데 어떻게?

translation.en: unless you do some things for me.
-Who pulled out your fingernail? -No one.
I have classified CIA documents.
You have documents?
So many documents. Who pulled out your nail?
An operative in Yemen. I went to ask her about you.
translation.ko: 예멘의 요원요, 당신에 관해 물으려고 그 여자를 찾아갔죠

translation.en: "Her." You know, you give away information without realizing it.
translation.ko: '그 여자', 너도 모르게 정보를 흘리고 있는 거 알지?

translation.en: I'm surprised you survived your trip.
It certainly doesn't inspire confidence
that you're the right lawyer to help me get out of here.
translation.ko: 빼내 줄 거라는 확신이 들지 않아

translation.en: -I am not here to get you out. -Games.
translation.ko: - 당신을 빼내러 온 거 아녜요 - 게임을 하자?

translation.en: I am bored.
-Tell your boss to call someone else. -Wait, hold on. Just--
translation.ko: - 보스한테 딴 사람 보내라고 해 - 잠깐만요! 저기…

translation.en: Hi, excuse me, one second, excuse me. Excuse me. Miss, please.
Give me those documents.
If you're telling me the truth, then I'll help you.
There. See?
Was that so hard?
-They're in a storage locker. -You have top-secret CIA documents
translation.ko: - 대여 창고에 있어 - CIA 기밀문서를 아무나 찾게

translation.en: in a storage locker where anyone can find them?
I like to live dangerously.
[Nyland] you need to secure those files ASAP.
Call the local FBI office and get an escort.
Yes, sir.
-You need me to send Kitchens to help? -No, sir. Definitely not.
-I've got this. -All right. Don't fuck this up.
[operator] You have reached the Phoenix Division of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
If you know your party's extension, you can dial it at any time.
translation.ko: 내선 번호를 알면 직접 번호를 누르세요

translation.en: For Cyber Division, press one.
For International Operations Division, press two.
For Critical Incident Response Group, press three.
For Criminal Investigative Division, press four.
You have pressed four, Criminal Investigative Division.
All investigators are--
Fuck it, man.
[woman over speaker] Empathy can be thought of in several ways.
translation.ko: 공감은 여러 가지 방법으로 생각할 수 있습니다

translation.en: The first is to contrast empathy with sympathy...
translation.ko: 첫 번째는 공감과 동정을 대조하는 것입니다

translation.en: In true psychopaths...
[in Spanish] Who the fuck is this guy?
...the parts of the brain that control empathy are dark.
Psychopaths have reduced connections
between the ventral medial prefrontal cortex,
the part of the brain responsible for...
We'll take the bag.
Bro, what's your plan here? It's not like you'll get out of there.
translation.ko: 어이, 계획이 뭐야? 거길 벗어날 방법은 없다고

translation.en: I'm sorry. Who are you?
We're the guys who are gonna take the bag. Did you not see his gun?
translation.ko: 그 가방을 가져갈 사람들 우리 총 못 봤어?

translation.en: No, I saw it, man.
Just not the first one I've seen today-- Yesterday.
translation.ko: 오늘 처음 본 총은 아니야 아니, 어제 말이야

translation.en: It was two days ago. I can't do the math, man.
-It's been an epically strange day. -No problem. We can end it for you.
translation.ko: - 오늘 정말 이상한 날이거든 - 괜찮아, 우리가 끝을 내줄게

translation.en: No, I'm good. Wasn't really complaining.
[Talco] Open the gate. Give us the bag, maybe we'll let you go home.
translation.ko: 문 열고 가방 넘겨, 집에 가자

translation.en: Not gonna happen, man. My bad.
You do know bullets go through metal, right?
Yeah. Yeah, I know.
[Owen] Hey, relax! Relax! Calmate!
I got it! It's fine! Come in. I got it.
-[Talco speaking Spanish] -[man] All right.
Shit.
[Talco] That was not cool, bro.
You made me run. I hate running.
The bag.
Fuck you.
[Max] You look rough.
You got a little bit of vomit...
Using me as an errand boy almost got me killed.
Who the fuck booby-traps a bag with acid?
translation.ko: 누가 가방에 산성물 부비 트랩을 설치하죠?

translation.en: A survivor.
Where's my money?
In my trunk. Who were the guys trying to get it from me?
translation.ko: 차 트렁크에 있어요 가방 뺏으려던 놈들은 누구죠?

translation.en: Disgruntled competitors. They think it belongs to them.
translation.ko: 불만을 품은 경쟁자 자기들 돈이라고 생각하지

translation.en: As soon as we're done, I'm giving it to the police.
Are you really this stupid?
No, you're not handing it over.
When you leave here, take the bag,
put it in a garbage can at the back of the parking lot,
translation.ko: 주차장 뒤쪽에 있는 쓰레기통 안에 넣어

translation.en: and I will have someone pick it up and secure it for me.
Why would I do that?
Because I have all the leverage. You have no idea who I am,
translation.ko: 히든카드는 다 내게 있어 넌 내가 누군지 모르잖아

translation.en: or what I know, Owen, and that should scare the shit out of you.
translation.ko: 내가 뭘 아는지도, 오언 이게 얼마나 겁나는 일이야?

translation.en: So I spent the afternoon going through your social media.
Thank you for giving me your real name by the way.
Who I am is hardly relevant.
I disagree because now I know everything you've done since college.
translation.ko: 천만에, 이제 난 너의 대학 시절부터의 삶을 다 알거든

translation.en: Every place you've lived. Every woman you've dated.
translation.ko: 네가 살던 곳, 네가 사귄 여자들

translation.en: I know that your father is buried in a military cemetery and...
you spend a lot of time there.
I don't need social media to know who you are, Max.
translation.ko: 당신을 파악하는 데 SNS는 필요 없어요

translation.en: I read your arrest report. I saw the photos of your house.
translation.ko: 체포 기록 봤어요 당신 집 사진도요

translation.en: You're a woman that lives without life. Not even one photo on any of your walls.
translation.ko: 그게 사는 거예요? 벽에 사진 한 장 안 걸렸던데

translation.en: What, no family? No friends?
No joy?
Seems like the only thing that you have is being a criminal.
translation.ko: 범죄자로 사는 것 말곤 아무 관심이 없나 봐요

translation.en: How I live my life isn't important.
I know about dozens of top secret CIA operations in Belarus and Russia
translation.ko: CIA가 러시아와 벨라루스에서 벌인 연줄 좋은 사람들이 관련된

translation.en: involving incredibly well-connected people.
translation.ko: 수십 개의 극비 공작에 관해 알아

translation.en: Stuff the agency would do anything to keep secret.
translation.ko: 비밀 유지를 위해서라면 CIA는 뭐든 할 거야

translation.en: So here's what you're going to do.
You're gonna go back to Langley and make sure the Company's number one priority
translation.ko: 랭글리로 가서 회사가 나에 대한 모든 기소를

translation.en: is having the murder charges against me dropped.
And if anyone there thinks it would be easier to have me killed,
translation.ko: 날 죽이는 게 더 쉽겠다고 판단해

translation.en: if anything happens to me, a press release will go out
detailing the minutiae of a decade's worth of clandestine operations.
translation.ko: 세부 사항이 보도 자료로 나올 거야

translation.en: -And guess who will be blamed? -I get it.
Let me call my boss.
Oh, my God.
No. Owen.
You're not calling your boss.
He isn't going to want anything to do with this.
translation.ko: 보스는 이 일에 관여하고 싶지 않다고

translation.en: When he finds out how bad this is,
he will do anything to wrap this around your neck.
There's no reason why you need to be collateral damage in all of this.
translation.ko: 너도 괜히 덤터기 쓸 필요 없잖아

translation.en: Do not try to manipulate me. Don't.
I'm just a lawyer doing my job.
translation.ko: 난 변호사로서 할 일을 할 뿐이에요

translation.en: No. You're just a lawyer standing in the middle of a minefield,
translation.ko: 넌 네가 서 있는 곳이 지뢰밭 한가운데인 걸

translation.en: and you don't even know it.
So, yeah. Do what you need to do.
Stumble around, blow yourself up,
or you can let me guide you through this so you don't destroy yourself.
translation.ko: 아니면 내 안내로 무사히 그곳을 빠져나오든

translation.en: [chuckles] Your compassion is touching,
but there's no way you're offering to help me out of the goodness of your heart.
translation.ko: 근데 선의로 날 도와줄 리가 없어요

translation.en: So, you don't have the leverage that you claim.
translation.ko: 그러니 당신 손에 쥔 건 뻥카란 뜻이죠

translation.en: -Oh, no? -No.
If I'm in a minefield, and I'm not buying your premise...
translation.ko: 내가 있는 곳이 지뢰밭이라면 당신 말을 안 믿어도

translation.en: you need me to get out safe or else you might not survive.
translation.ko: 날 무사히 빼내야 해요 아니면 당신도 살아남지 못하니까

translation.en: You really thought it was Christmas morning when I walked in here.
translation.ko: 아침에 내가 왔을 때 크리스마스 아침인 줄 알았죠?

translation.en: A kid fresh out of law school who doesn't even know how to run the copier. I think that's what you said.
translation.ko: 법대를 막 졸업해 복사기조차 못 쓰는 놈이라

translation.en: You thought you could manipulate and bully me into doing things your way,
translation.ko: 뜻대로 조종할 수 있다고 생각했나 본데

translation.en: but you made a mistake, I'm a guy that doesn't mind falling on his face
translation.ko: 한 가지 실수했어요 난 고꾸라지건 나자빠지건

translation.en: or getting in over my head.
I actually kinda like that.
It's why I get up in the morning.
So stop playing games.
I need you and you need me.
So let's make a deal.
Forget it. You're a murderer. The last thing I need is your help.
I'm going back to Langley, giving a full report on what happened.
I'll be in touch.
-Okay. -[Owen] Guard.
You do that, but before you leave, I have a parting gift for you.
translation.ko: 마음대로 해 근데 가기 전에 선물이 있어

translation.en: My handler was Not Bob.
-What is that, a fucking riddle? -No, your agency will know who it is.
translation.ko: - 수수께끼예요? - 아니, CIA는 누군지 알 거야

translation.en: -[door unlocks, then opens] -Good luck.
You're gonna need it.
[Max] So I spent the afternoon going through your social media.
Now I know everything you've done since college.
translation.ko: 이제 난 너의 대학 시절부터의 삶을 다 알거든

translation.en: Every place you've lived.
Every woman you've dated.
[Owen] Sor--- Just one second.
Oh, no. No.
No, no, no. What-- What time is it?
-What day is it? -It's 9 a.m. on Thursday.
Oh, fuck.
Fuck. Uh...
Last thing I remember, I-- I was eating...
Yep.
Those barbarians. They drugged me so they could go run their op.
translation.ko: 그 야만인들이 작전을 진행하려고 내게 약을 먹였어

translation.en: Uh, can't you stop them?
No, once they're wheels up, all I can do is damage control.
translation.ko: 시작된 이상 대책을 세우는 것 말곤 없어

translation.en: Well, so long as you're not busy, um,
if I said the name "Not Bob," what would you say?
What?
Hey, I ate an Ambien sandwich. I need short simple questions.
translation.ko: 나 수면제가 든 샌드위치 먹었어 질문은 짧고 간단하게

translation.en: Who is Not Bob?
-Everybody's heard of Not Bob. -I haven't.
He's a legend inside the agency,
ran the most dangerous ops in history, he retired as a division chief.
translation.ko: 가장 위험한 작전을 수행한 뒤 부서장으로 은퇴했지

translation.en: Why do we call him Not Bob?
Because he refused to use the pseudonym of Bob or Robert as a first name.
Well, I just got Not Bob's name from my graymailer.
-You're lying. -I'm not.
Assets don't know their case officers' real names,
and sure as shit wouldn't know an internal nickname.
People keep saying that she shouldn't know these things, and then she does.
translation.ko: 사람들 말대로라면 몰라야 하는 걸 그 여자는 다 알아요

translation.en: -So, what am I supposed to do? -Get out of my office.
Janus.
I have enough trouble trying to control my rogue spec ops team.
The last thing I need is any of your radioactive graymail case getting on me.
translation.ko: 방사선 뿜어대는 협박 편지까지 들이댈 필요 없다고

translation.en: Come on. It can't be that bad.
It's always that bad, you moron.
Not Bob isn't just some former king shit CIA officer.
translation.ko: '밥은 안 해'는 평범한 전직 CIA 요원이 아니야

translation.en: He is currently the chief of staff--
The-- The president?
For the fucking President of the United States.
So, what happened in Phoenix?
Well?
Upon interviewing Max Meladze,
I feel that her threat of graymail is credible
and requires further investigation.
Okay.
Keep me posted.
-Hello? -[Owen] I'm gonna ask you one question.
And if you answer honestly, I'll accept your offer.
What's the question?
Can I trust you?
When our interests align.
Otherwise, no.
I'm in.
